column4: when denyhosts does a block, where does it store that info and how do I remove it?
but removing it from there will not help, you will need to whitelist the ip
because next time it runs, it will see all the failures, and re-add it :)
check the docs, i cant remember exactly, but its pretty easy
get a free shell somewhere and use that
or get a trusted friend to do it for you
of course, after that change the password and have the friend killed
your ip is blocked, getting another ip will let you in
then its not denyhosts, unless you have a very interesting config
ssh -vvv host will give you more detail as to why you cant get in
why you say "get to the site" do you mean browse some web pages, or log on with ssh?
I can telnet to the domain.com 80 get the index.php but my browser gives network timeout
then your browser is the problem, have you tried using the ip address in your browser?
i think maybe you have dns issues then - so you have 2 apache vhosts on that box?
